intro: Urelytrum stapfianum, commonly known as the Stapf's urelytrum, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats and is adapted to cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and slender. Urelytrum stapfianum is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
